decoworld.model.world.map

Interface Map

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseMap, ClientMap, ServerMap

    public interface Map

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getFriendlyName()
      Returns the user-readable name of the map.
      int getHeight()
      Returns the height of the map, in tiles.
      Tile getTile(int x, int y)
      Returns the Tile at the specified position.
      TileSet getTileSet()
      Returns the TileSet associated with this Map.

      Returns the unique name of the map.

      Returns the width of the map, in tiles.
      boolean inRange(int x, int y)
      Returns whether the specified coordinate is within the dimensions of the map.
      void setTile(int x, int y, int tileID)
      This should only be used by the level editor team.

      This should only be used by the level editor team.

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the map, in tiles. This will be greater than zero.
        Returns:
        the width of the map, in tiles.

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the map, in tiles. This will be greater than zero.
        Returns:
        the height of the map, in tiles.

      • getFriendlyName

        java.lang.String getFriendlyName()
        Returns the user-readable name of the map. This will NOT be null. There is no guarantee of uniqueness across map instances.
        Returns:
        the user-readable name of the map.

      • getUniqueName

        java.lang.String getUniqueName()
        Returns the unique name of the map. This will NOT be null or empty.
        Returns:
        the unique name of the map.

      • getTile

        Tile getTile(int x,
           int y)
        Returns the Tile at the specified position. This will return the same tile object if two positions have the same type of tile.
        Parameters:
        x - The zero-based x-coordinate.
        y - The zero-based y-coordinate.
        Returns:
        the Tile at the specified position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if x or y parameters are invalid given the map bounds.

      • getTileSet

        TileSet getTileSet()
        Returns the TileSet associated with this Map.
        Returns:
        the TileSet for this Map.

      • inRange

        boolean inRange(int x,
              int y)
        Returns whether the specified coordinate is within the dimensions of the map.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:

      • setTile

        void setTile(int x,
           int y,
           int tileID)
        This should only be used by the level editor team. People wishing to generate Maps (Dungeons, etc) should simply call the constructor, not modifying the Map after construction. In future, modifications to a 'live' map will be processed by the server and distributed to clients. This will lift the above restriction. Alters the Tile at the given coordinates.

      • setTile

        void setTile(int x,
           int y,
           Tile tile)
        This should only be used by the level editor team. People wishing to generate Maps (Dungeons, etc) should simply call the constructor, not modifying the Map after construction. In future, modifications to a 'live' map will be processed by the server and distributed to clients. This will lift the above restriction. Alters the Tile at the given coordinates.
